myapp.GUIfx

Class DialogWindows

  • java.lang.Object
    • myapp.GUIfx.DialogWindows

  • public class DialogWindows
extends java.lang.Object
    The DialogWindows class contains methods to create different dialogwindows. The methods are used in the GUI classes to give the user useful information, or get input from user.
    Author:
    Sara Hjelle

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      DialogWindows() 

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      java.lang.String choiceDialog(java.lang.String content, java.lang.String header, java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> choices)
      This method creates a dialogwindow with a custom header, content text, and a choicebox.
      boolean confirmWindow(java.lang.String content, java.lang.String header)
      This method creates a dialogwindow to confirm an action.
      void errorWindow(java.lang.String message, java.lang.String header)
      This method creates a error dialogwindow with a custom message.

      Method to give a user information by creating a dialog window.
      java.lang.String inputDialog(java.lang.String content, java.lang.String header)

    • Constructor Detail

      • DialogWindows

        public DialogWindows()

    • Method Detail

      • errorWindow

        public void errorWindow(java.lang.String message,
                        java.lang.String header)
        This method creates a error dialogwindow with a custom message.
        Parameters:
        message - The message to be displayed in the dialogbox.
        header - The title of the dialogbox.

      • confirmWindow

        public boolean confirmWindow(java.lang.String content,
                             java.lang.String header)
        This method creates a dialogwindow to confirm an action. The content and headertext is custom, so it fits the situation.
        Parameters:
        content - The message to be displayed in the dialog window.
        header - The title of the window.
        Returns:
        true = confirmed, false = cancel or declined.

      • informationWindow

        public void informationWindow(java.lang.String information,
                              java.lang.String header)
        Method to give a user information by creating a dialog window.
        Parameters:
        information - The information you want to display in the dialog window.
        header - The title you want for your dialog window.

      • inputDialog

        public java.lang.String inputDialog(java.lang.String content,
                                    java.lang.String header)
        This method creates a dialogwindow with an inputfield. The method can be used when you want a user to write in the new value.
        Parameters:
        content - the informational text you want to appear in the dialogwindow.
        header - the header of the window.
        Returns:
        if user writes something in the inputfield and presses "ok" this text is returned, if the user presses cancel the method returns null.

      • choiceDialog

        public java.lang.String choiceDialog(java.lang.String content,
                                     java.lang.String header,
                                     java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> choices)
        This method creates a dialogwindow with a custom header, content text, and a choicebox. The choicebox shows a list of Strings the user can choose between.
        Parameters:
        content - the text to describe what the user should do.
        header - the header of the dialogwindow
        choices - arrayList of choices you want to be displayed in the box with choices.
        Returns:
        the method returns the chosen String, if one is chosen, or null if nothing is chosen or window is cancelled.
